definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
sound producing object (soundboard, vibrating string, membrane etc)

sentences.english: Women do phonological processing with both their right and left inferior frontal gyri .
sentences.chinese: 女人是利用她们左右眉骨后的侧脑回发音的。

sentences.english: Specifically, the clarity and projection of the altissimo range.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，可以影响高音区发音的清晰度和穿透力吗？

sentences.english: She said she had some difficulty with pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 她说她在发音方面有困难。

sentences.english: Many tapes don't have standard pronounciation.
sentences.chinese: 很多录音带上的发音不标准。

sentences.english: What do you think I should do to improve my English pronounciation?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我应该怎么做才能提高我的英语发音？

sentences.english: Imitative words are words that sound like the thing or action they stand for.
sentences.chinese: 拟声词是发音像它们所代表的意思的词。

sentences.english: Other languages have different pronunciations of the name of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 其他语言中对于“耶稣”这个名字发音不同。

sentences.english: Mispronunciation of this word is comparatively rare.
sentences.chinese: 把此字发音读错的人较少。

sentences.english: A baby cries and gurgles but does not use articulate speech .
sentences.chinese: 婴儿仅啼哭和咯咯作声，却无法清晰的发音。

sentences.english: School teachers probably cringe at this kind of pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 学校的老师们对这样的发音恐怕是不敢恭维。

sentences.english: The tongue is one of the vocal organs.

sentences.chinese: 我们更惊叹她那动人的发音。

sentences.english: If you are attending school, you must go through the different stages of learning pronunciation, grammar and reading.
sentences.chinese: 假如你是上学的，你必经过发音，文法，阅读等程序。

sentences.english: So names that are difficult to pronounce seem to have negative connotations?
sentences.chinese: 由上所述，发音难念的名字难道就有不祥的涵义吗？

definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
reading or phonetic value of a character
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate
